basic.description: This course focuses on the economic and social history of Sub-Saharan Africa in the twentieth century. Among the topics to be considered are: resistance and collaboration in the conquest of the continent; colonialism in theory and practice; the material basis of colonial society; the contradictions of colonialism and decolonization; economic crises and famines in an historical perspective.  One term seminar; winter.
basic.subject: HIST
basic.title: Capitalism In Sub-Saharan II
